title: Bobcat
synopsis: During an otherwise friendly interview with comedian Bobcat Goldthwait, Zorak reveals Space Ghost's secret identity: Tad Ghostal. Goldthwait agrees to party with Space Ghost after the show. The festivities are spoiled, however, by Zorak and his punk friends, The Ramones.

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yes! Hello, if you are watching us on other planets, I want you to know that... on Earth, I am the leader, I rule! everyone on Earth must follow me! Ha ha ha ha! (aside) Don't tell them the truth, okay, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost, welcome to the show. Joining me tonight, comedian Bobcat Goldthwait, and rock and roll citizens The Ramones.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (jamming) Hey ho, let's go! Hey ho, let's go!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak is all geeked up about the Ramones being here. (Zorak keeps jamming) That's good, Zorak. (keeps jamming) That's enough Zorak. (keeps jamming) Zorak! (jamming winds down & stops) My first guest (one more note interrupts Space Ghost) ... (taps cards) My first guest is a comedian. He is Bobcat Goldthwait, welcome him! (intro music plays & screen lowers; Zorak's face is on the screen instead of Bobcat)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (imitating Bobcat) Uh, hi, Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaah!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (back to normal voice) Your show is lame.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you done, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm Bobcat, interview me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're not fooling anyone, Zorak, we know it's you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Is this how you treat your guests?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wait!

transcript.speaker: (Moltar watches Zorak on monitor with the following caption, in mirror image writing
Inseca GeniiHelicoptera 2
transcript.dialogue: 3.9Phyl Disgustis 7Locusta Icky 3.5Creepy Cra{?}WeedhoppsSlimi Green {?}Surplus {?}LOCUST LINK

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sorry, man, boss's orders. (throws lever)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No! (zaps off screen; new image is infinite regression of Space Ghost's set)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, it's me, watching me, watching me, watching me!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Simpleton!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you lookin' at me? You must be lookin' at me. There's no one else here... (shoots at screen twice with power bands) (laughs) Alrighty!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Gawd, loser! (throws switch again, Bobcat appears)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Bobcat, welcome to the show.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Space Ghost, how are you today?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm energized, just like a jittering woodchuck. You know, when they cling to the side of a tree, and their jaws move up and down and up and down over and over really fast gaining speed until its just a blur of vibrating gums and lips (mouth becomes a blur) ... Energized! (more subdued) And, how are you, Bobcat?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: I'm livin' a dream, thanks a lot for having me back on the show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're certainly glad to have you back on the show.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Although I've never been on the show before, you ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course you haven't.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: You look pretty good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's because I've been lifting heavy objects.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Really? Yeah, well, it shows, you look pretty cut, you look pretty buff.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, aren't you sweet? I like you, Bobcat.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: I like you, Space Ghost. I got a question; what's, what's your real name?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Uhmmm...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Tad Ghostal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (glares at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Tad Ghostal? Really? Stick with Space Ghost, much cooler.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (face gets red) Er, I agree.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Wouldn't really work on the babes too much in a bar...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I, I agree...

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: "Hi, I'm Tad"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I realize that! (pause) Zorak's real name is Katy Did.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looking surprised) What?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Hi Zorak, how ya doin', pleasure to be on the show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh no, the pleasure is all mine! (Pathetic Earthling! Your feeble words do not amuse me!)

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? Do you eat your young?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looks surprised) Uh, um...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak eats anything, young, old, and then some! (Bobcat makes "Zorak" faces while Space Ghost talks) Say, Bobcat is a good name! Tell us, what's your secret identity?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: My secret identity? Like, if you saw me in real life?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, like if he saw you in real life.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Uhhhhh... I.. Joey Lawrence.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get out! I've got your album!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, girl, you know it's true.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I hear Blossom hates you.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Tad!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: See, it's an issue right now, and I feel strongly about it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't look very strong.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Well, I may look small, but I'm pretty wiry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, I've got a question for you, and this isn't, I'm not trying to be weird or anything, but... do you think I'm pretty?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks back blankly)

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Just like another guy to a guy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Ummm... Yes! I think you're a pretty man.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Thank you. I think you're kind of handsome too, Space Ghost. Although the locust, hmmm, I dunno.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (glares at him, "Psycho" music plays)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmmm, I see what you mean... But on a serious note, Bobcat, how would you stop crime in America?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: I think you wanna stop crime in America, you say a very special episode of "Blossom" where the entire cast gets ball-peen hammers in the knee caps...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ooooh...

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: I promise you there'll be a half-hour of non-violent America. Because everybody'd be glued to the set. "Hey, they hit Joey Lawrence in the knee cap yet?"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You think that could work?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Well, no, not really, perhaps I, I need to loosen my pants.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go ahead!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: (looses pants, sound of pressure escaping) Oooo! Man, I feel better already! Wooo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You should try spandex!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you know, I'm actually one of the only superheroes that wears leisure suits.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Speaking of heroes, who are yours?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Wow! Um, geez, I dunno, I like all the greats, you know, Curly. I think that's what my coif actually looks like, what if Rutger Hauer and Curly Howard pounded out a baby... "Hey, Moe, I'm a replicant! Ne ne ne ne ne!" (makes Stooge hand & face gesture)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (Replicants were the evil creation of Dr. Zin) (aloud) Ahem, let's see, where am I? (mumbles) Oh! Who is your arch enemy?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: John Tesh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The composer?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: The whole man. John Tesh scares me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, do you need any weapons?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, what size power band are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Colossal! Why?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Because I have a, I'm usually like a, a small power band, believe it or not, but I've been retaining a lot of fluids lately, so, probably like a medium power band.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about a nice pleated skirt?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Boy, Space Ghost, you're really switching gears!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, it's a 15 minute show! And, we have to take a break.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: What's the locust's name again, I'm sorry?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak. I like saying "Zorak".

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, play me something public domain.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays something from their vast easy listening library)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We'll be right back after this.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It appears we will be right back.
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, because no one can stop it, the show is back.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Barney's going to make more kids snap than Bugs Bunny.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: A kid knows Bugs Bunny's joking around, kids think Barney's for real!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: "I love you", you don't love us, Barney, you don't even know us!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay! We're back with Bobcat Goldthwait! I understand that you have special powers.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yes. I'm able to, uh, bend forks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: But only at Denny's. Any other kind of forks I don't seem to be able to bend.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, now, is this physically or mentally?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Um, I do it with my mind... but you gotta look away, really, for a little while.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When I said you were pretty, I meant you remind me of Judy Collins.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Judy Collins? (laughs) Wow, Space Ghost, man, crack a window, will ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'd be violently sucked into space.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Heh, then maybe people would tune in.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Well, I think Moltar's giving us the signal to wrap it up, huh, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Bobcat, that's just his way of telling us to finish the interview. Join us for dinner after the show?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, I'd love to join you for dinner, but I don't know about eating with no gigantic locust. Don't they spit on their food first and then mulch it up and spit it back out?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's regurgitational ingestion, flies do it, not locusts.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well that, but you know, that's exactly how I eat, so, perhaps I will dine with you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! We'll meet you in the chamber after the show. Any parting words?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, I want to party with you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You mean with a party cake and lemonade and paper hats?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Perhaps, perhaps.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty then! My next guests are Zorak's favorite band. Please welcome the Ramones!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Joey.

transcript.speaker: Joey Ramone
transcript.dialogue: (waves)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then. Identify yourselves, Ramones.

transcript.speaker: Johnny Ramone
transcript.dialogue: Hi, I'm Johnny Ramone.

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: And I'm Marky Ramone.

transcript.speaker: Joey Ramone
transcript.dialogue: And I'm Joey.

transcript.speaker: C. J. Ramone
transcript.dialogue: And I'm C.J.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And I'm Zorak Ramone.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And I'm Moltar Ramone.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to camera) They're not really Ramones. (to Ramones) Say, fellas, tell us about your new record.

transcript.speaker: Johnny Ramone
transcript.dialogue: "Acid Eaters", that's our latest album, it's a cover album of, uh, songs that were recorded in, um, generally around the 1967-68 period of time.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And it's just now coming out?

transcript.speaker: Ramones
transcript.dialogue: (all laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, guys, on your third album, "Rocket Fuel", (starts gibbering) whoops, too many Cokes.

transcript.speaker: Ramones
transcript.dialogue: (all laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah ha haa! Hey! Tell me about your music.

transcript.speaker: C. J. Ramone
transcript.dialogue: It's snappy.

transcript.speaker: Johnny Ramone
transcript.dialogue: It's always meant for rebellious kids.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Rebellious?

transcript.speaker: Johnny Ramone
transcript.dialogue: Uhhh, we're a bunch of punks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm... Well, you just listen to me, you punks, I don't want any trouble from you. This is a good show. This is a clean show. This is a good clean show.

transcript.speaker: C. J. Ramone
transcript.dialogue: You ever get a wedgie in tights? It's not pleasant. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uhhh...

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor, with Locust text from before, to Moltar) This is going as well as the Letterman-Madonna interview.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yup.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Allll right then, you punks, you're musicians, make something up for me.

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about: "way, we-we-way, wah wah-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah, way way way way way way-we-way."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Way way way"; that's catchy!

transcript.speaker: Joey Ramone
transcript.dialogue: It was subliminal.

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: That was, that was the instrumental part.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah!. Uh, do the word part.

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: How about: "Space Ghost, Space Ghost, you're the most, from coast to coast..."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, we have to go. Bobcat invited me to a party, with a party cake and lemonade and paper hats, and you can't come because you're punks and punks don't go to parties. Hey, you guys got a cake!

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: It's a nice chocolate vanilla.

transcript.speaker: Johnny Ramone
transcript.dialogue: There's plates right there...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Where'd you guys get that cake?

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: You want a piece of this?

transcript.speaker: C. J. Ramone
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's my party cake! Where did you guys get my party cake? Who gave them my party cake? I want my party cake! That was specifically definitely for Bobcat and me! Zorak! Did you give them my party cake?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with paper hat on & crumbs falling out of mouth) Uh, what party cake?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (with paper hat & cake) Mmmm, chocolate party cake.

transcript.speaker: Marky Ramone
transcript.dialogue: "Way, we-we-way, wah wah-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah, way way way way way way-we-way. (skip) we-way. (skip) we-way (skip) we-way." (fade out)
